title: How to Make Banana Bread Pie

steps.headline: Peal the bananas and mash them.
Put the mashed bananas in a bowl and add the self-raising flour.
Add the butter.
steps.description: It's best to add the butter in small chunks, so it'll be easier to stir it later on.

steps.headline: Stir until the dough is smooth.
Pour the dough in a quiche dish.
steps.description: Make sure you smear some butter in the dish, so your pie won't stick to the edges when it's done.

steps.headline: Place the dish in the oven for about 45 minutes.
steps.description: The pie should have crisp edges, but be a bit soft in the centre.

text: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).  Peal the bananas and mash them.  Put the mashed bananas in a bowl and add the self-raising flour.  Add the condensed milk.  Stir until it's well-mixed.  Add the butter. It's best to add the butter in small chunks, so it'll be easier to stir it later on. Add the eggs.  Stir until the dough is smooth.  Add the vanilla essence (optional).  Pour the dough in a quiche dish. Make sure you smear some butter in the dish, so your pie won't stick to the edges when it's done. Place the dish in the oven for about 45 minutes. The pie should have crisp edges, but be a bit soft in the centre.
